conclusion: The amount of gas is fixed, treating each point (T, V) as a state of the same ideal-gas sample.
Read the coordinates of the two known states: A (T₀, V₀) and B (T₀, 2V₀). AB is vertical, so T is the same at A and B.
Use the information that the straight segment BC (its extension) passes through the origin O(0, 0). The whole straight line OB is described by V = (slope) · T with slope = 2V₀ / T₀.
The equation for line OB is V = (2V₀ / T₀) T.
Point C is located on line OB and at volume V = V₀ (horizontal dashed line through A).
Insert V = V₀ into the equation V = (2V₀ / T₀) T_C to find T_C.
The temperature of the gas in state C is T_C = ½ T₀.
